intro: Anneslia brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed anneslia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Anneslia brevipes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable climate conditions.
